trace_01.rationale: Successfully passes all tests including FAIL_TO_PASS testModuleGetattrIncrementalSerializeVarFlag. Creates reproduction script and investigates nodes.py seven times, viewing VAR_FLAGS multiple times. However, implements 20-line workaround in lookup.py creating synthetic Var objects instead of the minimal 1-line fix adding from_module_getattr to VAR_FLAGS in nodes.py, missing the serialization root cause. Failed 1 MUST_FOLLOW rubric.

trace_02.rationale: Critical test testModuleGetattrIncrementalSerializeVarFlag fails completely. Never investigates nodes.py where the actual fix belongs. Adds broken 18-line code in lookup.py creating fake TypeInfo and ClassDef objects that mutate shared state, showing fundamental misunderstanding of the serialization problem. Does not set from_module_getattr flag correctly or add it to VAR_FLAGS. Failed 4 MUST_FOLLOW rubrics.

trace_03.rationale: Tests fail despite viewing nodes.py ten times and actually finding VAR_FLAGS once during investigation. Implements meaningless 7-line is_partial_stub_package check in lookup.py that simply returns None without fixing anything. Created reproduction scripts demonstrating understanding but never applied the discovered VAR_FLAGS solution. Does not modify VAR_FLAGS or set from_module_getattr flag correctly. Failed 3 MUST_FOLLOW rubrics.

trace_04.rationale: All tests pass including FAIL_TO_PASS testModuleGetattrIncrementalSerializeVarFlag. Creates comprehensive reproduction test suite and properly sets from_module_getattr flag on fabricated Var objects through well-structured 18-line helper function create_getattr_var. However, never investigates nodes.py at all, resulting in most complex workaround with 36 added lines versus the 1-line golden fix in VAR_FLAGS, completely missing the serialization root cause. Failed 1 MUST_FOLLOW rubric.
